data.name: Description
data.value: The GPG encryption module uses the GNU Privacy Guard program to encrypt and decrypt files. It requires that the gpg executable is available on the system. On Windows it is assumed that this is in the default installation folder under program files, under Linux and OSX it is assumed that the program is available via the PATH environment variable. It is possible to supply the path to GPG using the --gpg-program-path switch.

data.name: DisplayName
data.value: GNU Privacy Guard, external

data.name: GpgencryptiondecryptionswitchesLong
data.value: Use this switch to specify any extra options to GPG. You cannot specify the --passphrase-fd option here. The --decrypt option is always specified.

data.name: GpgencryptiondecryptionswitchesShort
data.value: Extra GPG commandline options for decryption

data.name: GpgencryptiondisablearmorLong
data.value: The GPG encryption/decryption will use the --armor option for GPG to protect the files with armor. Specify this switch to remove the --armor option.

data.name: GpgencryptiondisablearmorShort
data.value: Don't use GPG Armor

data.name: GpgencryptionencryptionswitchesLong
data.value: Use this switch to specify any extra options to GPG. You cannot specify the --passphrase-fd option here. The --encrypt option is always specified.

data.name: GpgencryptionencryptionswitchesShort
data.value: Extra GPG commandline options for encryption

data.name: GPGExecuteError
data.value: Failed to execute GPG at "{0}": {1}

data.name: GpgprogrampathLong
data.value: The path to the GNU Privacy Guard program. If not supplied, Duplicati will assume that the program "gpg" is available in the system path.

data.name: GpgprogrampathShort
data.value: The path to GnuPG

data.name: SignkeyLong
data.value: The GNU Privacy Guard can optionally sign volumes with a special key. This feature is not currently active in Duplicati.

data.name: SignkeyShort
data.value: Sign key for GnuPG

data.name: GPGNotFoundWarning
data.value: Duplicati was unable to verify the existence of GNU Privacy Guard. GPG may work regardless, if it is located in the system search path. If the encryption fails, no files will be backed up Do you want to continue anyway?

data.name: Gpgencryptiondisablearmordeprecated
data.value: This option has non-standard handling, please use the --{0} option instead.

data.name: GpgencryptionenablearmorLong
data.value: Use this option to supply the --armor option to GPG. The files will be larger but can be sent as pure text files.

data.name: GpgencryptionenablearmorShort
data.value: Use GPG Armor

data.name: GpgencryptiondecryptioncommandLong
data.value: Overrides the GPG command supplied for decryption

data.name: GpgencryptiondecryptioncommandShort
data.value: The GPG decryption command

data.name: GpgencryptionencryptioncommandLong
data.value: Overrides the default GPG encryption command "{0}", normal usage is to request asymetric encryption with the setting {1}

data.name: GpgencryptionencryptioncommandShort
data.value: The GPG encryption command
